main event: On 15 March 1951, a cigar-shaped object was observed over New Delhi, India by approximately 25 witnesses for about 7.5 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as dull and dark in color, maneuvered in loops and zig-zags, and was initially seen as a whitish cloud about 70 feet long at an altitude of 3-4,000 feet., The object was reported to have no noise or smoke, and its speed was estimated to reach up to 2,000 mph., Principal witness had a tendency to exaggerate., An individual employed as a Senior Mechanical Engineer corroborated seeing the object, estimating it to be 3 times the size of a full moon and hovering at about 4,500 to 5,000 feet., The document concluded various possibilities including that it was a balloon or aircraft but left much of the case unidentified.
witness description: varied, including a Senior Mechanical Engineer and local residents
